location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 113: Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, HC Sloop Clive, off Bushire, to Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter to Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, reports his arrival in the roads off Bushire. He states that he has stationed the Tigrisat the lower end of the Gulf with instructions to carry out duties in accordance with Kemball's letter of 11 May (no. 125). Robinson recounts his visit to the pearl banks at Bahrein [Bahrain] and states that no disturbances appear to have taken place there. He refers to a number of earlier letters (nos. 94, 96, 97, 100, 104, 107, 108, 109, 110 and 112) which detail the various political duties carried out on his recent cruise to the lower end of the Gulf.
